main event: A sighting of a tear-shaped, bluish white light with vapors was reported on October 21, 1959.
interesting points: The object appeared to burn out after emitting a bluish white light., The sighting lasted for about ten seconds., The object moved from east to west following a curve but did not go beyond the horizon., The description is similar to a meteor at high altitude., The observer was on the flying bridge of a picket ship during the sighting.
witness description: Lawrence, W.J., Seaman, USN, USS Skywatcher
